  • Method Details

    • submissionMessages

      @Scheduled(fixedDelay=30000L) public void submissionMessages()
      Process newly created submissions each 30 seconds

    • processedMessages

      @Scheduled(fixedDelay=30000L, initialDelay=10000L) public void processedMessages()
      Process external approved and rejected submissions each 30 seconds, but with an initial delay after the application starts of 10 seconds

    • processStaffSubmitted

      @Scheduled(fixedDelay=10000L, initialDelay=5000L) public void processStaffSubmitted()
      Process staff submitted submissions that failed to complete each 10 seconds, but with an initial delay after the application starts of 5 seconds.

      The failed to complete part here is important

      It means that the submission was processed, but failed in the middle of the process, so it needs to be reprocessed.

    • processedMessage

      public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<String> processedMessage(Integer submissionId, SubmissionProcessTypeEnum submissionType)
      Processes a submission message based on its ID and type.

      This method wraps the submission ID and type into a MessagingWrapper object, then proceeds through a series of steps to process the submission. Initially, it loads matching information for the submission. After loading, it processes the submission and checks if it is approved or auto-approved. If approved, the submission is persisted in the legacy system. If not approved, it proceeds to complete the processing without persistence. Finally, it builds and sends an email regarding the post-processing status.

      If any error occurs during the processing, it logs the error and continues with the next operations.
      Parameters:
      submissionId - the ID of the submission to be processed
      submissionType - the type of the submission process, indicating the origin or nature of the submission
      Returns:
      a reactor.core.publisher.Mono<String> that completes when the processing is done. The Mono emits the ID of the processed submission or an error signal if an error occurs during processing.
